resources.string: The notation is used to name the different possible movements in the layers of the cube to ease communication.
Notation
Parts of the cube
Edges
Corners
Centers
1. White cross
2. White corners
3. Second layer
4. Yellow cross
5. Yellow edges on their correct places
6. Yellow corners on their correct places
7. Route yellow corners
Final goal: to make a cross in which the four edges of the cross matches with the color of the sided centers.
\"Adress all the white edges to the white center face. \"
Rotate the layer until at least two edges fit with the sided centers color.
"R' U' R U R'"
"F U2 F' U2 F"
Now you could face two alternatives to swap the two remaining edges.
Done!!
Languages
white on left \nD\' R\' D R
white on right \nR\' D\' R
white on bottom \nR\' D2 R D R\' D\' R
Final goal.
Move the white corner under the spot where it is supposed to be.
And repeat for all the corners.
Now you can face 3 alternatives
A letter implies a single clockwise turn, a letter followed by \' means counter-clockwise turn and a letter followed by a number 2 means two turns.
"The centers do not move, they keep always in the same position, white opposite to yellow, red opposite to orange and blue opposite to green"
The red arrows indicate the two pieces that are swap and the letters indicate the movements that must be made following the notations that we have seen in the first section.
If you need to take a corner to put it somewhere else or it is in place but misdirected you have to do: R\' D\' R to move it out.
Put an edge that has to go to the second layer on top of a center with the same color
If you need to take an edge to put it somewhere else or it is in place but misdirected you have to do: U R U\' R\' U\' F\' U F to move it out
If you need the edge to go to the right \nU R U\' R\' U\' F\' U F
If you need the edge to go to the left \nU\' L\' U L U F U\' F\'
Now you can have two situations
Put the white face underneath
If you have a point do the algorithm and you will get an L
If you have an L do the algorithm and you will get a line
If you have a line do the algorithm and you will get a cross
Watch the edges, and check if you have: a point, an L shape, a line shape or you already have a cross \nAlgorithm: F R U R\' U\' F\'

Rotate the layer until only one edge fits with the color of a center and do R U R\' U R U2 R\' until they all fit (can be once or twice) If you can not fit just one edge do the algorithm and try again
Final goal, put all the corners of the last layer in the right place, they do not need to be well oriented.

Find a corner that is in the right place, put it to the right and do U R U\' L\' U R\' U\' L until all the corners are in the correct place (do it once or twice) If there is no corner in the right place do the algorithm and look again.

Now you just need to orient, put one of the corners that is not oriented up-right and do R\' D\' R D (do it two or four times as needed) until the corner is oriented, now with movements of U, U\' or U2 (DO NOT rotate the whole cube) put another corner that is not oriented and repeat the former movement. \n\nWhile doing this step it might seem that you have messed up the cube, do not worry.
Let\'s see an something.
Do R\' D\' R D twice but as the corner is not oriented we repeat the movement twice
Do U2 to put the other corner to the right and do R\' D\' R D twice and U2 to finish the cube
Categories
World Records are the following (up to September 2017)
Resources
Minigame
Timer
WCA: the official ranking.
cstimer: specialized Timer.
Cubecomps: results of competitions in progress.
